pullRequest.body:
These were placed on purpose; reverting them caused breakage downstream.

---

Follow-up to #9993.

nodes.body: I'm sorry for merging #9993 too soon.

:v: Ruben-VandeVelde can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
I have incorporated the suggestion and merged master.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7932180117/job/21658050534)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7932180117/job/21658049966)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7932180117/job/21658050257)

```suggestion
theorem continuous_def {_ : TopologicalSpace X} {_ : TopologicalSpace Y} :
```

I don't know whether this is necessarily the right thing to do (my downstream code does not care one way or the other), but I just wanted to note: to fully revert the change, you would need to re-add the `{f : X → Y}` parameter here after the `TopologicalSpace` parameters. Then I think you would not need the other changes in `Order.lean`.
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/e7170d39769f41a993b9e30c9eff0f80c3fac97d/Mathlib/Topology/Basic.lean#L1631-L1632
Indeed, I think it's better to have `f` come last.
Fair point. I have changed the order.
Maybe this line should now go below `continuous_def`?

```suggestion
-- The curly braces are intentional, so this definition works well with simp
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix(TopologicalSpace/Basic): restore curly braces in `continuous_def`

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Topology/Basic): re-use variables; rename a : X to x : X
